content:
That PR proves a generalized version of the Eisenstein criterion, where the polynomial X is replaced by an arbitrary monic irreducible polynomial.
This was more of a reaction after I read on Zulip that one couldn't prove irreducibility of X ^ 4 - 10 * X + 1 using the Eisenstein criterion.
That example is treated at the end.
(Possibly, that's just fun for number theorists.)
